subject: Politics
title: Censorship in the Digital Age
description: A quick win: understand Censorship in the Digital Age.

hook.text: China's Great Firewall blocks Google, YouTube, and Facebook. 1.4 billion people live in a separate internet.

buildup.text: Digital censorship lets governments block websites, filter search results, and monitor online communication.

discovery.text: China employs millions in internet censorship. Keywords are blocked in real time. AI monitors posts before they appear.

twist.text: Censorship has gone beyond blocking. Governments flood platforms with pro-state content to drown out dissent.

climax.text: VPNs and encrypted messaging let some users bypass censorship. But the cat-and-mouse game favors the state.

punchline.text: Digital censorship is smarter than book burning. It's invisible and scalable.

quiz.question: How has censorship evolved in the digital age?
options: Governments now flood platforms with pro-state content rather than just blocking
Digital censorship is less effective than traditional methods
No government currently censors the internet
